questions.question: Which of the following describes 'Counterparty Risk'?
options: The risk that interest rates will rise
The risk that the other party in a contract will fail to fulfill their obligations
The risk of a cyber attack on the bank's servers
The risk of losing a key employee
questions.explanation: Counterparty risk is the likelihood that the person or institution you're doing business with will default on their contractual obligations.

questions.question: Which derivative is commonly used to protect against the default of a bond issuer?
options: Interest Rate Swap
Credit Default Swap (CDS)
Currency Option
Commodity Future
questions.explanation: A CDS acts like insurance against a borrower defaulting on a loan or bond.

questions.question: What is the causative meaning of: 'The firm had the documents notarized'?
options: The firm notarized the documents themselves.
The firm paid someone else to notarize the documents.
The firm is currently notarizing the documents.
The firm refused to notarize the documents.
questions.explanation: 'Had + object + past participle' indicates that someone else performed the action for the firm.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'We need to ________ the compliance officer ________ the new policy.'
options: get / approve
have / approved
get / to approve
had / to approve
questions.explanation: The correct causative structure with 'get' (meaning to persuade) is 'get + person + to + infinitive'.

questions.question: In the context of ERM, what is 'Risk Appetite'?
options: The total amount of debt a company has
The level of risk an organization is prepared to accept
The cost of buying insurance for the whole company
The profit margin of the most risky department
questions.explanation: Risk appetite is the amount and type of risk an organization is willing to pursue or retain.
